This was a great spot for food after seeing a show at the Palau Musica since they stay open a little later than other restaurants in Barcelona.  It's tapas with a fine dining flair that we enjoyed as a change up from the salt-of-the-earth food we'd been indulging in previously on the trip.  We had a great bottle of cava.  The pork cheek bacon sandwich, pan con tomate, and poached egg with sausage and beans were all really delicious.  The staff were professional and attentive and seemed to have good English.  Their menu includes a Spanish, English, and French version.
